definition: Mahābhārata, second great Indian epic after 羅摩衍那|罗摩衍那[Luo2 mo2 yan3 na4], possibly originally c. 4th century BC

sentences.english: You see, these Bodhisattvas Mahasattvas are able to obtain great benefit.
sentences.chinese: 汝观彼诸菩萨摩诃萨，善获利益。

sentences.english: He was just this Bodhisattva Mahasattva Wondrous Sound.
sentences.chinese: 今此妙音菩萨摩诃萨是。

sentences.english: This dhamma desana of Than Acharn Maha Boowa is a rare and special one.
sentences.chinese: 尊者阿姜摩诃布瓦这次的宣讲是稀有罕见特别的一次。

sentences.english: This can be proven through the epic Mahabharata.
sentences.chinese: 史诗《摩诃婆罗多》就可以证明这点。

sentences.english: Shri Mahakali is the power of your left side, the power of desire.
sentences.chinese: 摩诃迦利是你左脉的力量，愿望的力量。

sentences.english: Maha Samadhi is the final conscious abandoning of the physical body.
sentences.chinese: 摩诃三摩地是放弃物理身体的最终意识。

sentences.english: Mahabharata is an educational book which touched ours hearts.
sentences.chinese: 《摩诃婆罗多》是一部触及人类心灵的警世之作。

definition: Nirvana (in Buddhist scripture)/Lord Brahma (the Hindu Creator)
Manes (3rd century AD), Persian prophet and founder of Manichaeism
honored sir (a person of higher status or seniority, or a Buddhist monk)
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
Mt Meru or Sumeru, sacred mountain in Buddhist and Jain tradition/Mt Xumi in Guyuan 固原[Gu4 yuan2], Ningxia, with many Buddhist cave statues
demon in Buddhism/poltergeist in temple that plays tricks on monks and has a taste for their food
Ceaseless pain (Sanskrit: Avici), one of the Buddhist hells/fig. hell/hell on earth
